problem.display_name: Advanced Numerical Input Problem with Hints and Feedback

numericalresponse.p: Use the quadratic formulaThe first hint of this problem will remind you of the quadratic formula, if you've forgotten. to find the roots of the equation \(x^2 - 3x + 2 = 0\). Input the higher of the two roots in the response box below.
numericalresponse.description: Full marks are given for the highest root. Partial credit is given for the other root.

div.p: Using the quadratic formula, the roots are found to be \(x = 2\) and \(x = 1\). Thus, the higher value, 2, is the correct answer here. The lower value, 1, would receive partial credit.

demandhint.hint: For the given equation \(x^2 - 3x + 2 = 0\), a = 1, b = -3, and c = 2.
Using the quadratic formula, one root is \(x = 2\) and the other is \(x = 1\).
